txt.en: The high canyon walls on either side of Khûn Sagaz ensure that any foolhardy enough to venture within have little hope of escaping the watchful gaze of the Orcs who dwell here.
There is beauty even in death, for at Urgudag flowers grow among the bone-piles assembled by the ravenous jackals of western Urash Dâr.
Deep within Sar-kidul, the Orcs have been kept busy fashioning great machines of war and training for the day they will be loosed upon the rest of the Ikorbân Valley.
The jackals of Khazâda have grown more bold in recent days, endangering the travellers who find they must travel in eastern Urash Dâr.
The encampment of Ab-dâna gives to the Orcs a view of much of the rest of Urash Dâr, providing a vantage point from which they can make their deadly plans for war.
Explore enemy camps, settlements, and lairs in Urash Dâr in the Ikorbân Valley.
Explore enemy camps, settlements, and lairs in Urash Dâr in the Ikorbân Valley.

Orcs have overtaken the stone keep of Maurûsh and pushed out the former Ordâkhai residents. From this defensible position, the Orcs can strike almost any location in Urash Dâr with very little warning.

Not content to remain within the dark cave where they were born, the scorpions of Dul Râkh boiled into the canyon outside. The scorpions overran the Orcs foolishly camped outside the cave mouth, and now the canyon belongs to them.

This ancient hermitage was built into the walls of a narrow, spring-fed gap where greenery thrives despite the arid climate. It was once the retreat of poets and philosophers, but that was long ago; in the years since it held a trove of secret lore, generations of robbers and brigands have used it to store their own plunder.
Tangled webs woven by the spiders that lurk at Ushbarab make travel in north-western Urash Dâr difficult, if not outright impossible.

The filthy and dangerous beasts known as kergrim have fashioned a lair among the rocks below the cliffside fortress of Ashâgir. The Shagâni call this place Tûkurdul, the 'gnaw-heap,' and no other name could best it.
